speaker: Ava
text: We plan to deploy the update on Friday night, right?
ipa: wi plæn tə dɪˈplɔɪ ði ˈʌpˌdeɪt ɑn ˈfraɪdeɪ naɪt, raɪt?
stress: We PLAN to DEPLOY the UPDATE on FRIDAY NIGHT, right?
linking:
"plan to" → /plæn tə/ (n + t linking)
"deploy the" → /dɪˈplɔɪ ði/ (y + th linking)

speaker: Liam
text: Yes, but we ought to prepare a full rollback strategy, just in case something goes wrong.
ipa: jɛs, bət wi ɔt tə prɪˈpɛɹ ə fʊl ˈroʊlˌbæk ˈstrætəʤi, ʤəst ɪn keɪs ˈsʌmθɪŋ ɡoʊz rɔŋ.
stress: Yes, but we OUGHT to PREPARE a FULL ROLLBACK STRATEGY, just in case SOMETHING goes WRONG.
linking:
"ought to" → /ɔt tə/ (t + t linking)
"prepare a" → /prɪˈpɛɹ ə/ (r + a linking)

speaker: Ava
text: Absolutely. I offered to help document the backup process yesterday.
ipa: ˌæbsəˈlutli. aɪ ˈɔfɚd tə hɛlp ˈdɑkjəˌmɛnt ðə ˈbækˌʌp ˈprɑsɛs ˈjɛstɚˌdeɪ.
stress: Absolutely. I OFFERED to HELP DOCUMENT the BACKUP PROCESS YESTERDAY.
linking:
"offered to" → /ˈɔfɚd tə/ (d + t linking)
"help document" → /hɛlp ˈdɑkjəˌmɛnt/ (p + d linking)

speaker: Liam
text: Thanks! Also, the managers expect us to present a risk analysis tomorrow.
ipa: θæŋks! ˈɔlsoʊ, ðə ˈmænəʤɚz ɪkˈspɛkt ʌs tə prɪˈzɛnt ə rɪsk əˈnæləsɪs təˈmɑroʊ.
stress: Thanks! Also, the MANAGERS EXPECT us to PRESENT a RISK ANALYSIS TOMORROW.
linking:
"expect us" → /ɪkˈspɛkt ʌs/ (t + u linking)
"present a" → /prɪˈzɛnt ə/ (t + a linking)

speaker: Ava
text: I'll get on that. I don't mind staying late today if necessary.
ipa: aɪl ɡɛt ɑn ðæt. aɪ doʊnt maɪnd ˈsteɪɪŋ leɪt təˈdeɪ ɪf ˈnɛsəˌsɛri.
stress: I'll GET on THAT. I DON'T MIND STAYING LATE TODAY if NECESSARY.
linking:
"get on" → /ɡɛt ɑn/ (t + o linking)
"staying late" → /ˈsteɪɪŋ leɪt/ (ng + l linking)

speaker: Liam
text: By the way, I can't stand dealing with those database migration scripts — they’re a nightmare.
ipa: baɪ ðə weɪ, aɪ kænt stænd ˈdiːlɪŋ wɪð ðoʊz ˈdeɪtəˌbeɪs maɪˈɡreɪʃən skrɪpts — ðeɪr ə ˈnaɪtˌmɛr.
stress: By the WAY, I CAN'T STAND DEALING with those DATABASE MIGRATION SCRIPTS — they're a NIGHTMARE.
linking:
"can't stand" → /kænt stænd/ (t + s linking)
"dealing with" → /ˈdiːlɪŋ wɪð/ (ng + w linking)

speaker: Ava
text: Haha, I don't mind handling them if you prefer. Honestly, I prefer focusing on backend stuff over front-end anyway.
ipa: ˈhɑˌhɑ, aɪ doʊnt maɪnd ˈhændlɪŋ ðɛm ɪf ju prəˈfɜr. ˈhɑnəstli, aɪ prəˈfɜr ˈfoʊkəsɪŋ ɑn ˈbækˌɛnd stʌf ˈoʊvɚ ˈfrʌntˌɛnd ˈɛniˌweɪ.
stress: Haha, I DON'T MIND HANDLING them if YOU PREFER. Honestly, I PREFER FOCUSING on BACKEND STUFF over FRONT-END ANYWAY.
linking:
"handling them" → /ˈhændlɪŋ ðɛm/ (ng + th linking)
"focusing on" → /ˈfoʊkəsɪŋ ɑn/ (ng + o linking)

speaker: Liam
text: That would be amazing. I tried updating them last week but ran into some issues.
ipa: ðæt wʊd bi əˈmeɪzɪŋ. aɪ traɪd ˈʌpˌdeɪtɪŋ ðɛm læst wik bət ræn ˈɪntu səm ˈɪʃuz.
stress: That WOULD be AMAZING. I TRIED UPDATING them LAST WEEK but RAN into some ISSUES.
linking:
"tried updating" → /traɪd ˈʌpˌdeɪtɪŋ/ (d + u linking)
"ran into" → /ræn ˈɪntu/ (n + i linking)

speaker: Ava
text: Maybe we should consider testing the scripts manually before running them in production.
ipa: ˈmeɪbi wi ʃəd kənˈsɪdɚ ˈtɛstɪŋ ðə skrɪpts ˈmænjuəli bɪˈfɔr ˈrʌnɪŋ ðɛm ɪn prəˈdʌkʃən.
stress: Maybe WE should CONSIDER TESTING the SCRIPTS MANUALLY before RUNNING them in PRODUCTION.
linking:
"should consider" → /ʃəd kənˈsɪdɚ/ (d + c linking)
"testing the" → /ˈtɛstɪŋ ðə/ (ng + th linking)

speaker: Liam
text: Good idea. Also, don't forget to notify the security team about the downtime window.
ipa: ɡʊd aɪˈdiə. ˈɔlsoʊ, doʊnt fɚˈɡɛt tə ˈnoʊtəˌfaɪ ðə sɪˈkjʊrəti tim əˈbaʊt ðə ˈdaʊnˌtaɪm ˈwɪndoʊ.
stress: Good IDEA. Also, DON'T FORGET to NOTIFY the SECURITY TEAM about the DOWNTIME WINDOW.
linking:
"don't forget" → /doʊnt fɚˈɡɛt/ (t + f linking)
"notify the" → /ˈnoʊtəˌfaɪ ðə/ (y + th linking)

speaker: Ava
text: Right. I'll remember to send them an email after this meeting.
ipa: raɪt. aɪl rɪˈmɛmbɚ tə sɛnd ðɛm ən ˈiˌmeɪl ˈæftɚ ðɪs ˈmitɪŋ.
stress: Right. I'll REMEMBER to SEND them an EMAIL after this MEETING.
linking:
"remember to" → /rɪˈmɛmbɚ tə/ (r + t linking)
"send them" → /sɛnd ðɛm/ (d + th linking)

speaker: Liam
text: And if something fails, we must stop to analyze the logs before trying a second deployment.
ipa: ænd ɪf ˈsʌmθɪŋ feɪlz | wi məst stɑp tə ˈænəˌlaɪz ðə lɔɡz bɪˈfɔr ˈtraɪɪŋ ə ˈsɛkənd dɪˈplɔɪmənt
stress: And if SOMETHING FAILS | we MUST STOP to ANALYZE the LOGS before TRYING a SECOND DEPLOYMENT
linking:
"must stop to" → /məst stɑp tə/ (stop + to smooth link)
"analyze the" → /ˈænəˌlaɪz ðə/ (z + th link)
"trying a" → /ˈtraɪɪŋ ə/ (ng + a glide)
"second deployment" → /ˈsɛkənd dɪˈplɔɪmənt/ (d + d smooth link)

speaker: Ava
text: Definitely. Rushing could end up causing bigger problems.
ipa: ˈdɛfɪnətli | ˈrʌʃɪŋ kəd ɛnd ʌp ˈkɔzɪŋ ˈbɪɡɚ ˈprɑbləmz
stress: DEFINITELY | RUSHING could END UP CAUSING BIGGER PROBLEMS
linking:
"could end up" → /kəd ɛnd ʌp/ (d + ɛ, p + k smooth connection)
"causing bigger" → /ˈkɔzɪŋ ˈbɪɡɚ/ (ng + b soft link)
